data.title: Classical Discoveries Home Page
data.meta_description: Classical Discoveries with Marvin Rosen - WPRB Radio Program
data.text:
TREASURES OF EARLY MUSIC

EACH TUESDAY - 7:00 - 10:00AM

Starting Tuesday, June 04 (until Sunday, September 01, 2024) TREASURES OF EARLY MUSIC is coming back to WPRB for the summer.

Treasures of Early Music is a special program curated and presented by the host of Classical Discoveries, Marvin Rosen, and is devoted exclusively to music before 1750.

Program will focus onarger, unknown and/or lesser known works that are rarely, if ever, presented on other stations.

Check this website or social media few days before each program for upcoming highlights.

If you have never listened to Classical Discoveries early music specials, please check some other programs >>>

TREASURES OF EARLY MUSIC

Sunday, September 01, 2024 from 7:00 till 09:00

This is the final program of summer series of early music

Here is a list of some of the works and composers to be presented:

PROGRAM WILL BE ANNOUNCED

Playlist and MP3 File: listen (*available after the broadcast)

Tuesday, July 02, 2024 from 7:00 till 10:00

Here is a list of some of the works and composers to be presented:

Juan de Araujo (1648-1712)

Francisco Lopez Capillas (1615-1674)

Juan de Herrera (1670-1738)

Juan De Lienas (1620-1654)

Ximeno Perez (?-1654)

Esteban Salas (1725-1803)

Manuel De Sumaya (c. 1678-1755)

Thomas de Torrejon Y Valasco (1644-1728)

and others as time permits

Playlist and MP3 File: listen (*available after the broadcast)

Wednesday, May 29, 2024 from 07:00am till 12:00pm

The entire show (in observance of Memorial Day) will be totally devoted to music by American composers. The program is titled "American Music - 50/50" - As in the annual marathons, 50/50 represents an approximate even representation of men and women composers.

Some Composers presented in this edition:

Beth Anderson (1950- ), Louis Wayne Ballard (1931-2007),

Henry Cowell (1897-1965), Kenneth Fuchs (1956- ),Jennifer Higdon (1962- ),Alan Hovhaness (1911-2000), Debra Kaye (1956- ), Robert Moran (1937- ),Kevin Puts (1972- ), Alex Shapiro (1962- ),William Susman (1960- ), Shelly Washington (1991- ), Adrienne Albert, Jennifer Bellor, Christopher Cerrone, Chen Yi, Daniel Dorff, Stanley Grill, Howard Hersh, Joanne Metcalf, Pauline Oliveros, Kile Smith, Rain Worthington and others

Wednesday, April 17, 2024from 7:00 till 10:00

SPRING MEMBERSHIP EDITION

MUSICAL ODDBALLS

WPRBâs spring membership began Tuesday, April 9 and will last until Sunday, April 21st The second Classical Discoveries membership drive program will be this Wednesday, April 17. It is titled Musical Oddballs and will feature works composed for unusual instruments. Included will be music for accordion, banjo, didjeridoo, harmonica, tabla, and many others.

Please support WPRB, home of Classical Discoveries by going to: https://pledge.wprb.com

Playlist

Wednesday, April 10, 2024 from 7:00 till 12:00

50 YEARS OF THE KRONOS QUARTET

SPRING MEMBERSHIP EDITION

WPRBâs spring membership drive begins this Tuesday, April 9 and will last until Sunday, April 21st.

My first special program will be this Wednesday, April 10th from 7:00 to 10:00am. At that time, Classical Discoveries will present a program in honor of the Kronos Quartet.

First 3 hours devoted to Kronos Quartet. Part 2 will include: Pawel Szymanski, Pawel Myketyn, Wojciech Kilar, GraÅ¼yna Bacewicz, Henry Cowell, Lou Harrison, Alan Hovhaness and others

Please support WPRB, home of Classical Discoveries by going to: https://pledge.wprb.com

Wednesday, August 09, 2023 from 7:00 till 10:00

Some Composers presented in this edition:

Mexican composer, Arturo Rodriguez (1976- )

American composer, Daron Hagen (1961- )

American composer, Quincy C. Hilliard (1954- )

Australian composer, Elena Kats-Chernin (1957- )

Taiwanese composer, Bunya Koh (1910-1983)

Lithuanian composer, Arvydas Malcys (1957- )

Greek composer, Charalambos Platanou (1985- )

American/Austrian composer, Nancy Van de Vate (1930-2023). 3 works aired in memory of the composer who past away on July 29.

Plus music by Thomas LaVoy, Claire McCue and Kazimierz Serocki and others as time permits

Playlist and MP3 File: listen (*available after the broadcast)

AMERICAN MUSIC FESTIVAL

Classical Discoveries presents a 3 day American Music Festival to celebrate the July 4Th Holiday:

Wednesday, June 28, 2023 from 7:00 till 10:00

Sunday, July 02, 2023 from 9:00am till 12:00pm

Wednesday, July 05, 2023 from 7:00 till 10:00

Playlist - 06/28/2023

Playlist - 07/02/2023

Playlist - 07/05/2023

and MP3 File: listen (*available after the broadcast)

TREASURES OF EARLY MUSIC

Thursday, June 15, 2023 from 7:00 till 10:00

Some Composers presented in this edition:

Italian composer, Giacomo Carissimi (1605-1674)

Italian composer, Camillo Cortellini (1561-1630)

English composer, William Croft (1678-1727)

Italian composer, Carlo Ambrogio Lonati (c. 1645-c. 1712)

Italian composer, Giovanni Maria Nanino (1544-1607)

German composer, Benedict Schultheiss (1653-1693)

Flemish composer, Matthias Hermann Werrecore (ca. 1523-1574)

Mexican composer, Manuel de Zumaya (c. 1678-1755)

Plus music by: Philippe de Monte, Carolus Hacquart, Giuseppe Sammartini, Aldebrando Subissati,

and others as time permits

Playlist and MP3 File: listen (*available after the broadcast)

Classical Discoveries can now be listened to on your computer, at any time and at your convenience for over two weeks after the MP3 files are posted on this website.

Each week's posting cannot be guaranteed due to various reasons beyond the webmaster's control. The file will be removed the following Wednesday after the posted date.

If you have any suggestions, feedback, questions or concerns, please forward them to the webmaster at: BeataRzeszodko.Rosen@gmail.com or MarvinARosen@gmail.com

Firefox does not work with the mp3 audio files at least for now. The tapes are cut off. Please for now, use other browsers or: You can also listen to the music files at: https://www.mixcloud.com/MarvinRosen/
